H0.text: The oceans contain most of the water on Earth.

H1.text: Watersheds contain most of the water on Earth.

H2.text: The atmosphere contains most of the water on Earth.

H3.text: Ice and aquifers contain most of the water on Earth.

A4.text: The total volume of water on Earth is estimated at 1.386 billion km3 (333 million cubic miles), with 97.5% being salt water and 2.5% being freshwater.

A5.text: Although in warm periods such as the Mesozoic and Paleogene... today most fresh water exists in the form of ice, snow, groundwater and soil moisture, with only 0.3% in liquid form on the surface.

A6.text: The ocean contains 97% of Earth's water and is the primary component of Earth's hydrosphere, acting as a huge reservoir of heat for Earth's energy budget, as well as for its carbon cycle and water cycle, forming the basis for climate and weather patterns worldwide.

A7.text: The ocean is essential to life on Earth, harbouring most of Earth's animals and protist life, originating photosynthesis and therefore Earth's atmospheric oxygen, still supplying half of it.
